> Agreed, but there's plenty of room to customize already, you can use :scope to prefix the routes and :as to override the default name. The one part you can't tailor is the key for the identifier.

The problem is that people start to see all of there routing requirements through `resources` and you end with them doing:

``` ruby
resources :products, :only => :index
```

instead of

``` ruby
get '/products'
```

> Alas, it looks like this work has already been done and pulled: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/5581

Hmm, must have been busy that day and @josevalim merged it before I could say anything. Well I'm not against it enough to make the case for reverting so I'll let it lie.
